stories.text:
I was just reading another thread about Google and Microsoft using our search against us in the ad wars, and was wondering how big an index would need to be for us to just have one local.

I wouldn't even care about the long tail, just say the top 10k web sites would do I think.

I wouldn't try and build it local by crawling, Id be happy to just download a big torrent an somehow patch it every week or so.
stories.title: How big would a web search index be to be able to run it localy

stories.text:
Lately I've seen many startups post "#1/2/3/ on Product Hunt". I know they also go into a good amount of effort to do this (e.g. write up a good post before, get all their friends to vote for them)

Does anyone with experience know if getting on PH #1/2/3 actually translates into something meaningful? e.g. a huge increase in adoption/downloads/awareness etc.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is Product Hunt Worth It?
